page.title: 12ATTITUDES (2)
page.content: Many of the people we talked to were old and had grown up families.Most of them had lived in South Mimms for over twenty years and some had been born in the village.Many of them had family connection in the area although some had originally moved there because of their job.Most of those interviewed thought there was not much to do in the immediate area especially for young people but that you could soon get to the sports facilities in Potters Bar,Borehamwood or Barnet if you had a car.The only other social activities mentioned seemed to revolve around the family or visits to local pubs.Older inhabitants said they didn't leave the village often and preferred gardening and a quiet lifestyle.
